Message.Title: Next Stock to Double
Message.Msg: The biggest boom in the upcoming months will be companies with the technology to deliver any video format, over any network, to any IP connected device. Harmonic (HLIT) today rose to a new 52-week high of $6.02 and after the close reported a non-GAAP EPS loss of ($0.02) down $0.05 from a non-GAAP EPS profit of $0.03 last year. HLIT's trailing twelve month non-GAAP EPS declined from $0.25 to $0.20 and the stock afterhours was trading for $5.89, which equals a P/E of 29.45. While HLIT's non-GAAP EPS declined $0.05 year-over-year, their competitor Concurrent (CCUR) reports on April 23rd and they are expected to report GAAP EPS of $0.09 and non-GAAP EPS of $0.13 vs. GAAP EPS of $0.04 and non-GAAP EPS of $0.08 last year. CCUR's trailing non-GAAP EPS will likely increase by $0.05 next week from $0.35 up to $0.40! This means CCUR will have double the trailing EPS of HLIT and CCUR closed Tuesday at only $6.77! With HLIT trading for $5.89 afterhours, CCUR could be ready to make a move to double HLIT's share price or $11.78! CCUR has only 8.72mm o/s, a market cap of $59.03mm, $24.6mm in cash, no debt, and an enterprise value of $34.43mm or just 0.55X its trailing revenue of $62.59mm. CCUR has huge gross margins of 58.81%, which are 30.69% higher than HLIT's gross margins of 45%. HLIT is trading with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 0.93. Clearly, CCUR deserves a multiple that is 30.69% higher than HLIT. This would give CCUR an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.22 and value CCUR at $11.58! HLIT recently sold their low margin cable access business for $46mm. It was breaking even with $52.9mm in revenue. HLIT's cable access business sold for 0.87X revenue when it only had gross margins of 30%! CCUR's gross margins are nearly double this and CCUR is about to report their 5th straight quarter of profitability! There is no way on earth that CCUR should have an enterprise value/revenue ratio of below 1, which values CCUR at $10 even. CCUR could rally to $10+ fast!

Message.Title: House report on fatal Benghazi attack faults State Department for security
Message.Msg: The terror attack on a U.S. outpost in Libya was preceded by security cutbacks authorized at the “highest levels” of the State Department, and the Obama administration’s explanation in the immediate aftermath of the fatal assault was altered to protect the agency, House Republicans said in a report on the issue released Tuesday. The 43-page report is the work of five House committees and concludes that decisions to scale back security at the Benghazi, Libya, outpost went all the way up to then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. The report cites a spring 2012 exchange in which Gene Cretz, the U.S. ambassador to Libya at the time, requested more security and Clinton responded by saying proceed with security-reduction efforts.

Message.Title: Boston bomb suspect's name was on classified government watch lists
Message.Msg: (Reuters) - The name of one of the Boston Marathon bombing suspects, Tamerlan Tsarnaev, was listed on the U.S. government's highly classified central database of people it views as potential terrorists. But the list is so vast that this did not mean authorities automatically kept close tabs on him, sources close to the bombing investigation said on Tuesday.

Topic.Title: "The Economic Argument is Over -- And Paul Krugman Won"

Message.Msg: Blodgett is laughable in his assessment which, if nothing else, proves that some people never advance intellectually beyond the 2nd grade, but still want their "teacher's" approval, even if it's for subpar effort. If the stimulus helped the economy so much, then why is unemployment so much higher now than when it was passed? And the stimulus was sold based on improving employment. It didn't. At all. Not one bit. And for those naive enough to believe the reported UE number is relevant (which by definition marks you as incompetent to even comment on this), we can't measure our country's health on what the gov't loves to report, which is just those who are still looking (however unsuccessfully) for work -- we have to take into account labor force participation rate, which has suffered an abysmal decline under Obama and his Krugman-esque policies and stands now at 63.3% on 155.6 million, down nearly 3% from 66.2% in 2008 on an available workforce of 154.0 million. 1.6 million more people are now competing in a workforce of 3.45 million fewer jobs than existed in 2008 AFTER the Obama porkulus was passed. And the unemployment rate is "down"? Hahahaha. So credit Krugman for that, too. Stimulus accomplished nothing, except to take more money away from future generations to accomplish nothing that nature wouldn't have already handled -- e.g., the self-destruction of the solar welfare companies, the Fisker welfare experiment, the new old car battery maker welfare recipient, and the multi-state emasculation of the public sector labor union welfare/campaign bundler groups. The only difference between nature and stimulus is that nature would have accomplished more at zero cost.

Message.Title: Obama made us pay for car used Beiber etc.
Message.Msg: (Reuters) - Republican lawmakers said the U.S. government missed early warning signs that its loans to electric carmaker Fisker Automotive could be in trouble, and kept money flowing even after the startup missed a key 2011 production deadline. The sporty Karma's $100,000-plus price tag and trappings of Hollywood glamor also drew barbs. "Taxpayers effectively subsidized luxury, novelty vehicles for the likes of Justin Bieber, Leonardo DiCaprio and Al Gore," said Jim Jordan, the Republican from Ohio who chairs the subcommittee which held the hearing. Under fire is the DOE's decision in 2009 to grant the company a $529 million loan only to see it veer toward failure - a chain of events that echoed Solyndra, the U.S. government-backed solar manufacturer that went out of business in 2011. F-king liberal #$%$.
